intro: Astragalus whitedii f. speirocarpus, commonly known as the speirocarpus form of Whited's milkvetch, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its botanical features include a taproot system and the ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
